pageContext.claim: “[Immigrants] coming in -- they're pouring in from other -- El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras, Mexico, all over.  They're just pouring into our country.  And we've stopped it, but the laws make it very tough.”
pageContext.analysis: People from the four countries Trump mentions represent a large share of the U.S. immigrant population. Immigration levels fluctuate from year to year, but it hasn't stopped. In fact, ICE arrested more people for deportation in 2017 than in the previous year.
